alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 11:32PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Burleson, southwestern Grimes, southwestern Brazos and central Washington Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1132 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Snook, or 15 miles southwest of College Station, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brenham, Navasota, Washington, Somerville, Snook, Lake Somerville Dam, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Lyons, Independence and Quarry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
